sections.title: A calm hygiene appointment to steady gums and keep your smile fresh
sections.body:
Hygiene visits focus on removing plaque and hardened tartar, checking gum health, and giving you practical guidance you can actually follow at home.

We take a clinician-led approach, explaining what we see around the gumline and between teeth, then tailoring the clean and advice to your needs.

Appointments are paced gently, with options for sensitive areas or anxious visitors.
bullets: Gentle scaling and polishing with gum health checks
Tailored advice for brushing, interdental cleaning, and sensitivity
Clear intervals so you know when to return and why

sections.title: Consistent hygiene keeps treatment conservative
items: Regular hygiene reduces inflammation and helps prevent gum disease
Professional cleaning reaches areas brushing alone misses
Tailored intervals keep implants, crowns, and fillings stable
Clear advice keeps stain, breath, and sensitivity concerns under control

sections.eyebrow: What happens in a hygiene visit
sections.title: Cleaning, gum checks, and practical guidance
sections.body: We start by listening to any concerns, then review gum health and areas that tend to trap plaque. Cleaning is gentle and methodical, with a focus on comfort and clarity.
bullets: Gum measurements and bleeding checks where indicated
Targeted scaling to remove plaque and tartar above and below the gumline
Polishing and advice on home care tools that suit your mouth

sections.title: Patients who benefit most from regular hygiene
items: People noticing bleeding gums, tenderness, or bad breath
Patients with implants, crowns, or bridges who need careful maintenance
Anyone prone to staining from tea, coffee, or smoking
Those managing dry mouth, orthodontic appliances, or dexterity challenges

sections.title: A clear, paced visit
items: Discussion of concerns and areas you want us to focus on
Gum health review and plaque assessment
Gentle scaling above and below the gumline
Polishing or airflow-style stain removal where suitable
Home care coaching on brushing, interdental cleaning, and sensitivity
Agreed recall interval based on your gum risk and history
sections.strapline: We keep things unhurried so you can stay comfortable and ask questions.

sections.title: Modern instruments with a gentle touch
sections.body: We use ultrasonic scalers, fine hand instruments, and airflow-style polishing to remove build-up efficiently while keeping you comfortable.

sections.title: What to expect after your appointment
items: Mild sensitivity can happen and usually settles within a day or two
Gums may look healthier quickly as inflammation settles
Avoid strong staining foods or drinks for the rest of the day if we polish
Follow the home care plan so results last longer

sections.title: Related care to explore
sections.strapline: Compare connected steps and plan the next visit.

faqs.question: How long does a hygiene appointment take?
faqs.answer: Most visits take around 30–45 minutes, depending on build-up and how much time you want for questions.

faqs.question: Will my teeth feel sensitive afterwards?
faqs.answer: Some people notice mild sensitivity for a day or two, especially if there was heavy tartar. We can adjust techniques and suggest soothing options.

faqs.question: Do you use airflow polishing, and is it suitable for me?
faqs.answer: We use airflow-style polishing when it is appropriate. We check for sensitivities, restorations, and gum health first so it stays comfortable.

faqs.question: How often should I book hygiene visits?
faqs.answer: Intervals vary. If you have gum concerns, implants, or a history of inflammation, we may suggest shorter gaps. We’ll explain the reasoning clearly.

sections.title: Where hygiene fits in your plan
sections.body: Hygiene is often the steady baseline alongside routine check-ups and gum care, keeping small issues from becoming bigger ones.
bullets: Often paired with Routine check-ups (/treatments/preventative-and-general-dentistry) for a full oral health review.
Helpful before or after gum care reviews (/treatments/periodontal-gum-care) when inflammation needs ongoing control.
Supports long-term maintenance for implants and restorations (/treatments/implants-aftercare).
If you’re nervous, we can pace visits and discuss support (/treatments/nervous-patients).

sections.title: Book a calm dental hygiene appointment
sections.body: Tell us about sensitivity or anxiety and we’ll tailor the pace. We can combine hygiene with a routine check-up if that helps.
